titleStmt.title: A sermon preached at Pauls Crosse, the 25. of Nouember. 1621 Vpon occasion of that false and scandalous report (lately printed) touching the supposed apostasie of the right Reuerend Father in God, Iohn King, late Lord Bishop of London. By Henry King, his eldest sonne. Whereunto is annexed the examination, and answere of Thomas Preston, p. taken before my Lords Grace of Canterbury, touching this scandall. Published by authority.
titleStmt.author: King, Henry, 1592-1669.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A68300 of text S108024 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 14969.5). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 103 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 47 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: A sermon preached at Pauls Crosse, the 25. of Nouember. 1621 Vpon occasion of that false and scandalous report (lately printed) touching the supposed apostasie of the right Reuerend Father in God, Iohn King, late Lord Bishop of London. By Henry King, his eldest sonne. Whereunto is annexed the examination, and answere of Thomas Preston, p. taken before my Lords Grace of Canterbury, touching this scandall. Published by authority.
titleStmt.author: King, Henry, 1592-1669.
Preston, Thomas, 1563-1640.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston, for William Barret,

notesStmt.note: A reply to a statement in: Broughton, Richard. English protestants plea, and petition, for English preists and papists.
The first leaf and the last leaf are blank.
A later state of STC 14969, with the words "Whereunto is annexed .." added to the title page.
M3v is blank. Variant: M3v has errata.
Identified as STC 14969 on UMI microfilm reel 841.
Reproductions of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 841 and at reel 1604 (same copy filmed twice).

keywords.term: Broughton, Richard. -- English protestants plea, and petition, for English preists and papists -- Controversial literature -- Early works to 1800.
